doc.title: 1H25 revenue and GPM beat; strong growth in ESS; reiterate Buy
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/1H25 revenue and GPM beat strong growth in ESS reiterate Buy1H25 revenue and GPM beat strong growth in ESS reiterate Buy_2025-08-28

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 24.00 HKD | Price: 21.60 HKD

CALB reported 1H25 results on 27 August: total revenue was RMB16.4bn, up \(32\%\) YoY/7% HoH, \(4\%\) above our expectation. GPM in 1H25 was \(17.5\%\) , up 1.9ppt YoY/1.4ppt HoH, above our estimate of \(15.8\%\) . Operating income (clean EBIT) came in at RMB1.1bn, up \(73\%\) YoY/237% HoH and \(21\%\) above our estimate. Net income was RMB466mn, up \(87\%\) YoY/36% HoH, missing our estimate by \(38\%\) , mainly due to higher-than- expected financial costs, income tax expenses and more profit shared to minority shareholders.

In 1H25, CALB's EV battery sales came in at RMB10.7bn, up \(10\%\) YoY. ESS battery and other business revenue came in at RMB5.8bn, up \(110\%\) YoY. On shipment, we estimate that CALB shipped \(- 45GW\) battery in 1H25 (+78% YoY), with around 24GWh/21GWh from EV/ESS battery, \(+38\% / + 165\%\) YoY respectively. For EV battery, its shipment volume growth in 1H25 was largely supported by the demand growth from XPeng, Leapmotor and Geely, as well as the solid demand from commercial vehicle customers. Its solid growth of ESS battery was largely helped by the rush installation of renewable energy in China before May- 2025. We estimate 1H25 ASP of EV/ESS battery to drop \(- 20\% /21\%\) YoY to RMB0.44/0.27 per Wh, respectively, mainly due to lithium price decline, while 1H25 EVB price is up \(24\%\) HoH. By region, CALB recorded revenue of RMB326mn from the overseas market in 1H25, accounting for \(2\%\) of the total sales.

Factoring in the 1H25 results, we cut our 2025/26/27E EPS forecast by \(21\% /15\% /7\%\) on higher sales and GPM forecast, but with higher expectation of income tax expenses and earnings attributable to non- controlling interests. Our new PO of HKD24 (was HKD25) is derived from a weighted average valuation of DCF (40%), EV/EBITDA (30%), and EV/Sales (30%, see details inside). We reiterate Buy on CALB, due to 1) solid EV and ESS battery shipment growth in 2025; (2) improving profitability on better economies of scale and solid product mix; and (3) gradual overseas capacity- expansion plans to ensure its future growth.
\\* For full definitions of \\*method\\* measures, see page 8.
\\* For full definitions of method measures, see page 8.

Yikai Liu, CFA >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Hong Kong)

Key Metrics\\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 8.

CALB is a leading lithium battery maker in China focusing on EV (electric vehicles) batteries and ESS (energy storage system) products. CALB supplies EV batteries for most of the EV makers in China. It also supplies to global OEMs (original equipment manufacturers). CALB's battery installed capacity ranked No.3 in China in 2024. CALB listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in October 2022.

We have Buy rating on CALB, as we see following positives: (1) solid EV & ESS battery shipment growth in 2H25- 2026, (2) improving profitability on better economies of scale and better product mix, (3) gradual oversea capacity expansion plans to support its future growth.
Exhibit 1: 1H25 results comparison
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
Exhibit 2: New vs. old estimates
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 3:P&L summary (half-year) We expect 2025E net profit to be up \(149\%\) YoY
Source: BofA Global Research estimates

We derive our new PO of HKD24 (was HKD25) from a weighted valuation of DCF (40%), EV/EBITDA (30%) and EV/sales (30%). The weights of the three methods are unchanged. We assign a higher weighting to the DCF method, as we believe that it better captures the company's value amid a tightening environment.

DCF valuation: We derive a fair value of HKD27.9 (was HKD30.7) from our DCF calculation, assuming 1% FCF perpetual growth (unchanged) and 7.4% WACC (was 7.1%) due to updated beta and capital structure.
EV/EBITDA valuation: We derive a fair value of HKD21.4 (was HKD21.5) from 15x target EV/EBITDA (unchanged) over average 2025/26E EBITDA.
EV/sales valuation: We derive a fair value of HKD21.1 (was HKD21.0), based on 2.0x target EV/sales (unchanged) over average 2025/26E sales.
Exhibit 4: Valuation summary Our PO is HKD24
Valuation methodologyImplied value (HKD)Upside/downside potentialParametersMethodology 1DCF27.9WACC of 7.4%Methodology 2EV/EBITDA21.415xMethodology 3EV/sales21.12xPO (rounded)24.011%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates

We derive our PO of HKD24 from a weighted valuation of DCF \((40\%)\) , EV/EBITDA \((30\%)\) and EV/sales \((30\%)\) valuation. We assign a higher weighting to the DCF method as we believe it better captures the stock's value amid a tightening environment.
DCF valuation: A fair value of HKD27.9 is based on \(7.4\%\) WACC and \(1\%\) perpetual growth.

EV/EBITDA valuation: A fair value of HKD21.4 is derived from 15x target EV/EBITDA over average 2025- 26E EBITDA. Our target multiple of 15x is \(25\%\) more than the peer average, as we see improving GPM/ROE of the company.
EV/sales valuation: We derive a fair value of HKD21.1, based on 2x target EV/sales over average 2025- 26E sales. Our target multiple of 2.0x is in line with the peer average.

Downside risks: raw material price hike, market share loss on intensified competition, ASP risks on industry over- supply, IP infringement claims, concentration of customers, lower- than- expected capacity expansion.
Upside risks: better- than- expected NEV sales, raw material prices decline, overseas /ESS business grows faster than expected.

Qmethod is the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of Qmethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls. Qtobase is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research. Qprofile, Qmethod are service marks of Bank of America Corporation. Qtobase is a registered service mark of Bank of America Corporation.

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0- 12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
Investment ratingTotal return expectation (within 12-month period of date of initial rating)Ratings dispersion guidelines for coverage clusterR2Buy≥ 10%≤ 70%Neutral≥ 0%≤ 30%UnderperformN/A≥ 20%
R2Ratings dispersions may vary from time to time where BofA Global Research believes it better reflects the investment prospects of stocks in a Coverage Cluster.

INCOME RATINGS, indicators of potential cash dividends, are: 7 - same/higher (dividend considered to be secure), 8 - same/lower (dividend not considered to be secure) and 9 - pays no cash dividend. Coverage Cluster is comprised of stocks covered by a single analyst or two or more analysts sharing a common industry, sector, region or other classification(s). A stock's coverage cluster is included in the most recent BofA Global Research report referencing the stock.
Price Charts for the securities referenced in this research report are available on the Price Charts website, or call 1- 800- MERRILL to have them mailed.
